newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam to sell 70 bln dong worth of T-notes.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam to sell 70 bln dong worth of T-notes.

text.p: Vietnam will auction 70 billion dong ($6.32 million) worth of one-year Treasury notes later today, an official at the State Bank of Vietnam said on Wednesday.
At the last sale of government paper, on October 9, the central bank issued 70 billion dong worth of one-year notes to domestic institutions at an annual rate of 7.90 percent.

There have been 13 such sales so far this year, through which a total of 860 billion dong worth of Treasury stock has been issued. The central bank is aiming to hold one auction every two weeks to lay the ground for a future secondary market.

Rates have fallen sharply in recent months, partly due to a dong surplus in the banking system. At the first sale of the year, on March 1, the state bank sold six-month bills at a rate of 15.00 percent.
